titlestmt.titleproper: Preiminary guide to the Rich Gold papers M1510
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-01-30 15:38:52 -0800.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Collection includes: notebooks (114), manuscripts, documentation, artwork, correspondence, and the manuscript for his currently unpublished book, The Plenitude. Also included are boxes of patents, awards, slides, video tapes, audio tapes, CDs, photographs, and documentation materials (including the World Economic Forums of 1999, 2000, and 2001).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection includes: notebooks (114), manuscripts, documentation, artwork, correspondence, and the manuscript for his currently unpublished book, The Plenitude. Also included are boxes of patents, awards, slides, video tapes, audio tapes, CDs, photographs, and documentation materials (including the World Economic Forums of 1999, 2000, and 2001).

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rich Gold was a digital artist, inventor, cartoonist, composer, lecturer and inter-disciplinary researcher. He was a provocative speaker who lectured throughout the world on the future of the book, the nature of engineering, creativity, innovation and Evocative Knowledge Objects (EKOs) [from the Rich Gold website, 5/13/2011]

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Rich Gold papers ( previous hit M1510 ). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research; material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use
